examples: The refreshing mombin juice quenched my thirst on a hot summer day.
Distant water will not quench your immediate thirst, and it's important to address pressing issues first.
When my colleague tried to solve a problem with a quick fix, I reminded them that dirty water will quench fire.
When I want to quench my thirst, I reach for a cold glass of ugli fruit-infused water.
It was a hot summer day, and the refreshing mallow tea quenched my thirst.
words.defineEn: satisfy (thirst)
words.defineVi: thỏa mãn (cơn khát)

examples: so she could imbibe the air of nature and play at the work so many were forced to do.
Now, the consensus is that the amount of water we need to imbibe depends largely on our weight and environment.
words.defineEn: take in liquids
words.defineVi: lấy chất lỏng

words.defineEn: drink down entirely
words.defineVi: uống hết

examples: The children drank their juice from colorful plastic glasses.
My parents always drink orange juice for breakfast.
Get a drink for John.
I usually drink a cup of green tea in the afternoon.
My brother always drinks smoothie after exercising.
words.defineEn: to put water, coffe, or other type of liquid inside of our body through our mouth
words.defineVi: để đưa nước, cà phê, hoặc loại chất lỏng khác bên trong cơ thể của chúng tôi thông qua miệng của chúng tôi

examples: Insects, hummingbirds, and even bats, stick their faces into flowers to drink up some sweet, sweet nectar, and get pollen all over themselves in the process.
The spacecraft stayed up there for two-and-a-half years, with its sample collector exposed to solar wind, drinking up ions.
words.defineEn: to consume the entire contents of a glass, bottle, or other container that holds a beverage
words.defineVi: để tiêu thụ toàn bộ nội dung của một ly, chai, hoặc container khác mà giữ một đồ uống

examples: Has Trump drained the swamp in Washington?
Britain has suffered a huge brain drain in recent years.
He laughed like a drain instead of giving me a hand.
She was laughing like a drain when I got there.
Ronald Reagan called for draining the swamp of bureaucrats in Washington D.C. while in 2006.
words.defineEn: empty of liquid; drain the liquid from
words.defineVi: hết chất lỏng; thoát chất lỏng từ

examples: Nobody chugs pickle juice.
The weapon on the left, however, is still chugging away.
Chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, yes!
Chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, yes!
Chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, chug, yes!
words.defineEn: to consume a beverage, usually a carbonated or alcoholic one, quickly and in large gulps
words.defineVi: tiêu thụ đồ uống, thường là đồ uống có ga hoặc có cồn, một cách nhanh chóng và từng ngụm lớn

words.phonetic: tə dɹɪŋk tʊ ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to raise a glass and drink a toast in honor of a person or thing, usually as a sign of respect, celebration, or good wishes
words.defineVi: nâng ly và nâng cốc chúc mừng một người hoặc một vật, thường là một dấu hiệu của sự tôn trọng, lễ kỷ niệm hoặc lời chúc tốt đẹp

examples: I can't speak tonight because of the glug glug.
I can't speak tonight because of the glug glug.
It's actually pretty liquefied, it's just coming through a small hole, so it's glug glugging.
words.defineEn: make a gurgling sound as of liquid issuing from a bottle
words.defineVi: tạo ra âm thanh ọc ọc khi chất lỏng chảy ra từ chai

examples: When his head broke the surface he took in deep gulps of air.
They gulp and swallow water almost constantly.
Its needle-like teeth hook squid one half its size and its jaws can gulp them down.
He gulps air into his body to create enough internal pressure to pop the top of his old shell.
Mine are all down with two big gulps of cola.
words.defineEn: to swallow hurriedly or greedily or in one draught
words.defineVi: nuốt vội vàng hoặc tham lam hoặc trong một bản nháp

examples: The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
His parents are always breathing down his neck.
My debts are a millstone round my neck.
The bullet got him in the neck.
She wore a necklace around her neck.
words.defineEn: to drink alcohol quickly or eagerly
words.defineVi: uống rượu một cách nhanh chóng hoặc háo hức

examples: The nurse takes my blood pressure.
The nurses had to spoon-feed my mother after her stroke.
I thanked the nurse for her compassionate care during my stay in the hospital.
The nurse kindly explained the procedure to me and helped me feel at ease.
Nurses play an important role in providing healthcare and assisting doctors in treating patients.
words.defineEn: to sip or drink a beverage slowly or gently
words.defineVi: nhấm nháp hoặc uống nước giải khát từ từ hoặc nhẹ nhàng

examples: When his head broke the surface he took in deep gulps of air.
They gulp and swallow water almost constantly.
Its needle-like teeth hook squid one half its size and its jaws can gulp them down.
He gulps air into his body to create enough internal pressure to pop the top of his old shell.
Mine are all down with two big gulps of cola.
words.defineEn: to swallow hurriedly or greedily or in one draught
words.defineVi: nuốt vội vàng hoặc tham lam hoặc trong một bản nháp

examples: The children sipped on fruity herbal tea with flavors of berries and citrus.
To take a bite/drink/sip.
He sipped his drink, feeling the cool liquid touch his lips.
He sipped the steaming chicken broth, feeling its comforting warmth soothe his sore throat.
I feel thirsty and need a sip of water.
words.defineEn: to drink a liquid by taking a small amount each time
words.defineVi: uống một chất lỏng bằng cách uống một lượng nhỏ mỗi lần

examples: - He slurped.
And slurp out the innards.
Then, with a few jerky movements, they slurp the snail out.
Can I slurp it?
Hey, you're not slurping, man.
words.defineEn: to eat or drink noisily by inhaling a liquid or soft food, such as soup or noodles, often with a distinctive, impolite sound
words.defineVi: ăn hoặc uống ồn ào bằng cách hít thức ăn lỏng hoặc mềm, chẳng hạn như súp hoặc mì, thường có âm thanh đặc biệt, bất lịch sự

examples: When his head broke the surface he took in deep gulps of air.
They gulp and swallow water almost constantly.
Its needle-like teeth hook squid one half its size and its jaws can gulp them down.
He gulps air into his body to create enough internal pressure to pop the top of his old shell.
Mine are all down with two big gulps of cola.
words.defineEn: to swallow hurriedly or greedily or in one draught
words.defineVi: nuốt vội vàng hoặc tham lam hoặc trong một bản nháp

words.defineEn: to drink quickly or gulp down a beverage, often in a casual or informal manner
words.defineVi: uống nhanh hoặc nốc cạn đồ uống, thường theo cách bình thường hoặc trang trọng

examples: - Washed down all them taters.
He's washing down cauliflower with cauliflower.
Alright, give me something to wash down those taters. -
Like, when your parent saw you wash down an entire pizza with a 2-liter bottle of whatever your caffeinated beverage of choice is.
Deltas are formed when dirt and other debris that are washed down the river accumulate, or build up, to form a piece of land.
words.defineEn: eat food accompanied by lots of liquid; also use metaphorically
words.defineVi: ăn thức ăn có nhiều chất lỏng; cũng sử dụng ẩn dụ

examples: The refreshing mombin juice quenched my thirst on a hot summer day.
Distant water will not quench your immediate thirst, and it's important to address pressing issues first.
When I want to quench my thirst, I reach for a cold glass of ugli fruit-infused water.

words.defineEn: the state of having a dry mouth and needing water or other drinks
words.defineVi: tình trạng khô miệng và cần nước hoặc đồ uống khác

examples: I feel thirsty and need a sip of water.

'I'm thirsty.'
words.defineEn: wanting or needing a drink
words.defineVi: muốn hoặc cần một thức uống
